name: Sanhaj
desc: The great priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind and Border Master, who bore the Ancient NameHe died in the Battle of the Mare Jivari 500 years ago.

imgDesc.text: The heir of Sanhaj's Ancient Name, Ororon, and Sanhaj.

customize.name: Masters of the Night-Wind
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Mictlan. They are famous for their predictions and rituals to amplify the ability to communicate with the Night Kingdom and the Wayob.

customize.text: Sanhaj Kompore was a famous storyteller and the tribe's Border Master. The most powerful Border Masters can expand the borders of the Night Kingdom, and temporarily manifest part of it in the real world. Sanhaj foresaw the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text:
, so he began to weave a great net of lies, to turn the stacks of woven scrolls into a veil, so as to hide a past that should not again be touched. Sanhaj was disliked by many because he often bet against people from other tribes and deceived them.
Mare Jivari
During the Cataclysm, Sanhaj summoned a miniature Night Kingdom and exploded it to defeat the encroaching dark calamity. The battlefield was reduced to a desolate wasteland and became known as the Mare Jivari. Sanhaj and Tenoch, the leader of the tribal coalition forces, gave their lives to activate this spell.

customize.name: Tenoch
customize.desc: A hero of Natlan, who lived 500 years ago. He didn't belong to any tribe, because he was exiled. During the Cataclysm, he united the six tribes and went to the western islands to fight a giant black monster.

customize.text:
Although Sanhaj foresaw his and Tenoch's end in the Battle of the Mare Jivari, he joined him to fight the Abyss.
Mahamba
An Iktomisaurus, Sanhaj's companion. Sanhaj Kompore was born silent, and the tribal elder said that half of his soul had been lost in the night flames. To seek his missing self, Sanhaj went to the barren land of stone as a child, and only the enigmatic Mahamba agreed to accompany him.

customize.name: Ororon
customize.desc: A young man from the Masters of the Night-Wind who instead lives in the wild alongside all manner of life.

customize.text: A hero of Natlan who participated in

customize.name: Haborym
customize.desc: The name Haborym is supposedly borne by all mortal Archons of Natlan. The current Archon is Mavuika.

customize.text:
's plan. He is the heir of the Ancient Name Bidii.
Conulaf
Sanhaj's descendant

customize.name: Calamity of Eshu
customize.desc: A ceremonial blade forged by Sanhaj, the great high priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind. In tales of bygone days, Sanhaj could use this curved blade to perform rituals, blurring the boundary between the Night Kingdom and the present world.

customize.name: Chain Breaker
customize.desc: A jade-adorned longbow. The gentle winds always seem to swirl gently about its string. Legends claim that this weapon was made in a far more ancient era by a dragon artisan.

customize.name: Talking Stick
customize.desc: Most people will find this obsidian-inlaid club quite convincing indeed.

customize.name: Shuttle of Odara
customize.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "Calamity of Eshu."
Refracting an eerie, prism-like light, this jade pendant emits a chilling aura that does not disappear, even were it to be cast within a roaring blaze.
In ancient shamanic traditions, the "shuttle" symbolizes a medium that pierces through different realms. It is said that in the era of barbarism, before humans knew how to count their days or to weave their tales, the mighty dragons who then roamed the Soulfire Plains had a word for a construct that traversed the pitch-black darkness between the stars. In their long-forgotten language, they called such creations "Void Shuttles" â€” blazing javelins that could pierce anything, even a veil thick enough to enshroud an entire world.
Of course, given that the source of this story was the crafty trickster Sanhaj, it may well be that this was nothing but another of his countless tall tales, told with the sole intention of earning himself a meal and a drink. Today, some of the most respected priests of the Masters of the Night-Wind still hold this view.

customize.name: Mysterious Weapon Fragment: Arrow Rest
customize.desc: A fragment of a weapon once wielded by Sanhaj Kompore, Border Master of the Masters of the Night-Wind. It was broken into its currents [sic] state during the great war five hundred years past. According to Granny Itztli's intuition, it may aid the Traveler in some inexplicable way at some future point in their journey.
